channel.title: Microsoft Learn - in Intune
channel.description: The latest updates from Microsoft Learn in Intune

item.title: Using Remote Help on Windows to assist authenticated users. - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Remote Help app to provide remote assistance to authenticated users who also run the Remote Help app, and to troubleshoot for frontline workers (FLW).

item.title: Factory Reset Protection Emails Not Enforced in Intune for Android - Intune
item.description: Describes an issue in which an Android Enterprise device can be activated by using a Google account that isn't included in the "Factory reset protection emails" setting.

item.title: Understand Microsoft Intune management extension - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand Microsoft Intune management extension for Windows.

item.title: Add Microsoft 365 Apps to Windows devices using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how you can use Microsoft Intune to install Microsoft 365 apps on Windows 10/11 devices.

item.title: Troubleshoot Win32 apps in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the most common methods to troubleshoot Win32 app issues with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Windows app deployment by using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about Windows 10/11 app deployment scenarios available with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Data protection for Windows MAM - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable protected MAM access to org data using Windows MAM.

item.title: Add and assign an app - Microsoft Intune
item.description: In this article, you'll use Microsoft Intune to add and assign an app.

item.title: Review app protection policy logs - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This topic describes how to configure Intune app protection policy (APP) logs.

item.title: Intune Data Warehouse Collections - Microsoft Intune
item.description: The Intune Data Warehouse collections provide details related to the Data Warehouse API.

item.title: Install Microsoft 365 apps to macOS devices using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how you can use Microsoft Intune to install Microsoft 365 apps on macOS devices.

item.title: Enable Win32 apps on S mode devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enable Win32 apps on S mode devices using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Graph APIs to configure devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See a list of all the Graph API entities with the matching Windows CSP and offset URI on Windows 10 devices and newer used when configuring devices in Microsoft Intune. See the matching API and CSP for shared PCs, endpoint protection, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, identity protection, Windows 10 Teams, kiosk, and Windows Update client policies.

item.title: Prepare a Win32 app to be uploaded to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to prepare a Win32 app to be uploaded to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Win32 app management in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to manage Win32 apps with Microsoft Intune. This article provides an overview of the Intune Win32 app delivery and management capabilities.

item.title: Add and assign Win32 apps to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add, assign, and manage Win32 apps with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Deploy Windows update packages in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to deploy a Windows update package (.msu file) in Intune.

item.title: Add apps to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to add apps to Microsoft Intune so you can assign apps to users and devices. Intune supports a wide range of app types.

item.title: Discovered apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand details about the detected apps that Intune found on a device.

item.title: What is app management in Microsoft Intune? - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about client app management capabilities by platform for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Supported Microsoft Intune apps - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article provides lists of support partner and Microsoft apps that are commonly used with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add Microsoft Edge to macOS devices using Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about adding Microsoft Edge to macOS devices using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Add Microsoft Edge for Windows to Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about adding Microsoft Edge for Windows to Microsoft Intune.

item.title: How to configure the Intune Company Portal apps, Company Portal website, and Intune app - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how you can configure the Intune Company Portal apps, Company Portal website, and Intune app.

item.title: Add PowerShell scripts to Windows devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create and run PowerShell scripts, assign the script policy to Microsoft Entra groups, and use reports to monitor the scripts. See the steps to delete scripts you add on Windows devices in Microsoft Intune. Read common issues and resolutions.

item.title: Deploy Intune policies to manage Windows LAPS - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Create policies to manage the Windows Local Administrator Policy Solution (LAPS) on Windows devices that enrolled with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Configure Microsoft Intune for increased security - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to improve your security posture with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Intune App SDK for Android developer integration and testing guide - Plan the integration - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Plan the integration to incorporate Intune mobile app management (MAM) into your Android app.

item.title: Enable Windows Backup for Organizations in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Enable Windows backup and restore in Intune for employees or students.

item.title: Manage account protection settings with endpoint security policies in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune endpoint security account protection policies to protect the identity and accounts of users.

item.title: Overview of Windows LAPS with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how you can use Microsoft Microsoft Intune and application protection policy to manage the local administrator accounts on Windows devices. Through the Windows LAPS CSP, back up accounts and passwords to Microsoft Entra ID, define password requirements, and protect account passwords through scheduled password rotations and manual rotations at need.

item.title: What's new in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Find out what's new in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: In development - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes Microsoft Intune features that are in development.

item.title: Learn about using Intune to manage Microsoft Defender settings on devices that aren't enrolled with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Intune policy to manage Microsoft Defender security settings on devices that aren't enrolled with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage approved apps for Windows devices with App Control for Business policy and Managed Installers in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use App Control for Business policies and a managed installer to manage which apps are approved to run on Windows devices that you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Collect Diagnostics - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to collect diagnostics with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Learn about Intune security baselines for Windows devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Deploy security baselines that have preset and recommended configurations to the Windows devices you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Find lost devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Locate lost or stolen devices by using the locate device feature in Microsoft Intune. Get details on security and privacy information when using the locate device action.

item.title: Android app protection policy settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: This article describes the app protection policy settings for Android devices.

item.title: Encrypt macOS FileVault disk encryption with Intune policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune policy to configure FileVault on macOS devices, and use the admin center to manage their recovery keys.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Disable Activation Lock - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use Microsoft Intune to disable Activation Lock on Apple devices.

item.title: Use Microsoft Defender for Endpoint in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Integrate Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with Microsoft Intune as a Mobile Threat Defense solution.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Reset Passcode - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to reset a passcode with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Sync - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use the device sync remote action in Intune to apply policy, app, and configuration updates to managed devices.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Send Custom Notifications - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Intune to create and send custom notifications to users of iOS/iPadOS and Android devices.

item.title: Windows Antivirus policy settings for Microsoft Defender Antivirus for Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See a list of the settings in the Microsoft Defender Antivirus profile for Windows devices. You can configure these settings as part of Endpoint security Antivirus policy in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Settings list for the Microsoft Intune security baseline for Microsoft Defender for Endpoint - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the settings in the Microsoft Intune security baseline for Microsoft Defender for Endpoint and each settings default value.

item.title: Scenarios for using Conditional Access with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how Conditional Access is commonly used with Intune compliance policy for devices and apps

item.title: View report details for encryption status of devices managed with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the Microsoft Intune admin center to view reports for device encryption status across macOS FileVault and Windows BitLocker encrypted devices that you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Intune endpoint security firewall settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Endpoint security firewall policy settings for Windows and macOS in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Protect devices with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn about the Intune capabilities that can help you protect your devices and data against unauthorized access and other threats.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Lost Mode - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to enable Lost Mode in Microsoft Intune to remotely lock a lost or stolen iOS or iPadOS device and display a custom message and phone number on the lock screen.

item.title: Intune endpoint security disk encryption policy settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View the list of settings that are available in Microsoft Intune endpoint security disk encryption policy settings for BitLocker and FileVault.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Update Cellular Data Plan - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to update the cellular data plan for iOS/iPadOS devices that support eSIM with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Monitor security baselines deployed by Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Monitor device and per-setting results of security baselines you deploy with Microsoft Intune, and identify conflicts for devices.

item.title: Intune endpoint security Account protection (Preview) policy settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Endpoint security Account protection policy settings in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Antivirus policy settings for Windows Security experience policy for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Endpoint security Antivirus policy settings for the Windows Security app in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Remote Device Action: Remove User - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to remove a user from a Shared iPad with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Logout current user - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use the logout the current user from a Shared iPad with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Windows Antivirus policy settings from Windows security settings for tenant attached devices in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review the settings in the *Windows Security experience* profile for tenant attached devices. To use this Endpoint security Antivirus policy, you must first configure tenant attach for Configuration Manager for Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Shutdown - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to shutdown Apple devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Onboard and Configure Devices with Microsoft Defender for Endpoint via Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Integrate Microsoft Defender for Endpoint with Microsoft Intune, including connecting the products, onboarding devices, and assigning policies for compliance and risk level assessment.

item.title: Encrypt Windows devices with Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use Microsoft Intune policy to manage encryption of Windows devices with either BitLocker or Personal Data Encryption.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Wipe - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to wipe, or factory reset, devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Quick Scan - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to initiate on demand Microsoft Defender quick scan with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: BitLocker Key Rotation - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to rotate the BitLocker recovery key with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Intune endpoint security Attack surface reduction settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Details about the settings in the endpoint security Attack surface reduction policies in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Intune endpoint detection and response policy. - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure and deploy policies for devices you manage with endpoint security endpoint detection and response policy in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage devices with endpoint security in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how Security Administrators can use the Endpoint Security node to view devices and manage them in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Use Endpoint Privilege Management to transition users from administrator to standard user - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Understand the steps and phases for using Endpoint Privilege Management to transition users from administrators to standard users.

item.title: Remote Device Actions – Wipe, Lock, Locate, and More - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Discover how to use Microsoft Intune to remotely manage, wipe, lock, restart, and secure Android, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, Windows, and ChromeOS devices. Learn about available remote actions, prerequisites, and bulk actions for IT admins.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Run Remediation - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to initiate on demand remediations with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Remove Apps and Configuration - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how apps and configurations can be removed temporarily, then restored automatically or manually using the Remove apps and configuration device action with Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Intune reports - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Intune provides specific report types with focused views that contain consistent and timely data.

item.title: Intune Remote Action: Rotate FileVault Recovery Key - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to rotate the FileVault recovery key with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage antivirus settings with endpoint security policies in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure and deploy policies and use reports for devices you manage with endpoint security antivirus policy in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Settings list for the Microsoft Edge security baseline in Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: View a list of the settings in the Microsoft Intune security baseline for Microsoft Edge browser. This list includes the default values for settings as found in the default configuration of the baseline.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Remove Passcode - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to remove a passcode with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage firewall settings with endpoint security policies in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure and deploy policies for devices you manage with endpoint security firewall policy in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Delete - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to delete devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: New Remote Assistance Session - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use the the new remote assistance session action in Intune to offer support to your users.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Retire - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to retire device using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Tutorial-Get started with cloud-native Windows endpoints
item.description: Set up secure cloud-native Windows endpoints that are Microsoft Entra joined, enrolled in Intune, and then deploy at scale with Windows Autopilot.

item.title: Windows Antivirus policy settings from Microsoft Defender Antivirus for tenant attached devices - Microsoft Intune
item.description: See a list of the settings in the Microsoft Defender Antivirus profile for Windows devices managed by Configuration Manager. You can configure these settings as part of Endpoint security Antivirus policy in Microsoft Intune after you configure tenant attach for Configuration Manager.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Rotate local admin password - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to rotate the local admin password on Windows and macOS devices with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Play Lost Mode Sound - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use the Play lost device sound remote action in Microsoft Intune to trigger an audible alert on a lost, stolen, or misplaced device—helping users locate it quickly and securely.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Pause Config Refresh - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to temporarily pause policy enforcement on Windows 11 devices using Intune's Pause Config Refresh remote action to support troubleshooting and manual changes.

item.title: Intune endpoint security Endpoint detection and response settings - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Endpoint security Endpoint detection and response policy settings for deprecated profiles in Microsoft Intune

item.title: Configure security baseline policies in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Deploy security baselines that establish a default and recommended security postures on Windows devices you manage with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Remote Lock - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Use the remote lock action in Microsoft Intune to lock a managed device that has a passcode or PIN.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Rename Device - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to use the Rename device remote action in Microsoft Intune to update the device name shown in the admin center. Useful for standardizing naming conventions, managing shared devices, and improving inventory clarity.

item.title: Learn about using Endpoint Privilege Management with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: To enhance the security of your organization, set your users to run with standard permissions while Endpoint Privilege Management ensures those users can seamlessly run specified files with elevated rights.

item.title: Use reusable groups of settings policies in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Manage groups of settings for Intune profiles as a single object and then add that settings group object to multiple profile instances. Later changes you make to the settings groups automatically apply to each profile that includes the reusable settings group.

item.title: Intune Remote Action: Deprovision - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to deprovision a chromeOS device with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Remote Device Action: Full Scan - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how to initiate on demand Microsoft Defender full scan with Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Network endpoints for Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Review endpoints for Intune. This page lists IP addresses and port settings needed for proxy settings in your Intune deployments.

item.title: Role-based access control (RBAC) with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Learn how RBAC lets you control who can perform actions and make changes in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Manage attack surface reduction settings with Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure and deploy policies for devices you manage with endpoint security attack surface reduction policy settings in Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Microsoft Intune endpoint security disk encryption policy - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Configure and deploy Microsoft Intune endpoint security policy disk encryption policies for BitLocker and FileVault.

item.title: Manage endpoint security policies in Microsoft Intune - Microsoft Intune
item.description: Security Administrators can use the Endpoint Security policies and profiles to focus on security configuration of devices in Microsoft Intune.
